properties.name: performance
properties.docs: The performance that controls the bottom sheet's position. The BottomSheet widget will manipulate the position of this performance, it is not just a passive observer.

properties.name: title
properties.docs: The (optional) title of the dialog is displayed in a large font at the top of the dialog.

properties.name: content
properties.docs: The (optional) content of the dialog is displayed in the center of the dialog in a lighter font.

properties.name: actions
properties.docs: The (optional) set of actions that are displayed at the bottom of the dialog.

properties.name: colorBrightness
properties.docs: Controls the default text color if the text color isn't explicit set.

InkWell.name: InkWell
InkWell.docs: An area of a Material that responds to touch.

Material.name: Material
Material.docs: Describes a sheet of Material. If the layout changes (e.g. because there's a list on the paper, and it's been scrolled), a LayoutChangedNotification must be dispatched at the relevant subtree. (This in particular means that Transitions should not be placed inside Material.)

MaterialButton.name: MaterialButton
MaterialButton.docs: Base class for buttons in the Material theme. Rather than using this class directly, please use FlatButton or RaisedButton.

properties.name: colorBrightness
properties.docs: Controls the default text color if the text color isn't explicit set.

TabBar.name: TabBar
TabBar.docs: Displays a horizontal row of tabs, one per label. If isScrollable is true then each tab is as wide as needed for its label and the entire [TabBar] is scrollable. Otherwise each tab gets an equal share of the available space. A [TabBarSelection] widget ancestor must have been built to enable saving and monitoring the selected tab.

Align.name: Align
Align.docs: Aligns its child box within itself.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the child.

properties.name: widthFactor
properties.docs: If non-null, sets its width to the child's width multipled by this factor.

properties.name: heightFactor
properties.docs: If non-null, sets its height to the child's height multipled by this factor.

AnimatedContainer.name: AnimatedContainer
AnimatedContainer.docs: A container that gradually changes its values over a period of time.

properties.name: constraints
properties.docs: Additional constraints to apply to the child.

properties.name: decoration
properties.docs: The decoration to paint behind the child.

properties.name: foregroundDecoration
properties.docs: The decoration to paint in front of the child.

properties.name: margin
properties.docs: Empty space to surround the decoration.

properties.name: padding
properties.docs: Empty space to inscribe inside the decoration.

properties.name: transform
properties.docs: The transformation matrix to apply before painting the container.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, requires the decoration to have this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, requires the decoration to have this height.

properties.name: curve
properties.docs: The curve to apply when animating the parameters of this container.

properties.name: duration
properties.docs: The duration over which to animate the parameters of this container.

AnimatedModalBarrier.name: AnimatedModalBarrier
AnimatedModalBarrier.docs: Prevents the user from interacting with widgets behind itself.

properties.name: color
properties.docs: If non-null, fill the barrier with this color.

properties.name: performance
properties.docs: The performance to use when animating the given [color].

properties.name: dismissable
properties.docs: Whether touching the barrier will pop the current route off the [Navigator].

AspectRatio.name: AspectRatio
AspectRatio.docs: Forces child to layout at a specific aspect ratio.

properties.name: aspectRatio
properties.docs: The aspect ratio to use when computing the height from the width.

properties.name: name
properties.docs: The name of the image in the assert bundle.

properties.name: bundle
properties.docs: The bundle from which to load the image.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this height.

properties.name: colorFilter
properties.docs: If non-null, apply this color filter to the image before painint.

properties.name: fit
properties.docs: How to inscribe the image into the place allocated during layout.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the image within its bounds.

properties.name: repeat
properties.docs: How to paint any portions of the layout bounds not covered by the image.

properties.name: centerSlice
properties.docs: The center slice for a nine-patch image.

AsyncImage.name: AsyncImage
AsyncImage.docs: Displays an image provided by an [ImageProvider].

properties.name: provider
properties.docs: The object that will provide the image.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this height.

properties.name: colorFilter
properties.docs: If non-null, apply this color filter to the image before painint.

properties.name: fit
properties.docs: How to inscribe the image into the place allocated during layout.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the image within its bounds.

properties.name: repeat
properties.docs: How to paint any portions of the layout bounds not covered by the image.

properties.name: centerSlice
properties.docs: The center slice for a nine-patch image.

Baseline.name: Baseline
Baseline.docs: Positions its child vertically according to the child's baseline.

properties.name: baseline
properties.docs: The number of logical pixels from the top of this box at which to position the child's baseline.

properties.name: baselineType
properties.docs: The type of baseline to use for positioning the child.

Block.name: Block
Block.docs: A mashup of [ScrollableViewport] and [BlockBody]. Useful when you have a small, fixed number of children that you wish to arrange in a block layout and that might exceed the height of its container (and therefore need to scroll).

BlockBody.name: BlockBody
BlockBody.docs: Uses the block layout algorithm for its children.

properties.name: direction
properties.docs: The direction to use as the main axis.

ClipOval.name: ClipOval
ClipOval.docs: Clips its child using an oval.

properties.name: clipper
properties.docs: If non-null, determines which clip to use.

ClipRRect.name: ClipRRect
ClipRRect.docs: Clips its child using a rounded rectangle.

properties.name: xRadius
properties.docs: The radius of the rounded corners in the horizontal direction in logical pixels.

properties.name: yRadius
properties.docs: The radius of the rounded corners in the vertical direction in logical pixels.

ClipRect.name: ClipRect
ClipRect.docs: Clips its child using a rectangle.

properties.name: clipper
properties.docs: If non-null, determines which clip to use.

Column.name: Column
Column.docs: Lays out child elements in a column.

ConstrainedBox.name: ConstrainedBox
ConstrainedBox.docs: Imposes additional constraints on its child.

properties.name: constraints
properties.docs: The additional constraints to impose on the child.

Container.name: Container
Container.docs: A convenience widget that combines common painting, positioning, and sizing widgets.

properties.name: child
properties.docs: The child to contain in the container.

properties.name: constraints
properties.docs: Additional constraints to apply to the child.

properties.name: decoration
properties.docs: The decoration to paint behind the child.

properties.name: foregroundDecoration
properties.docs: The decoration to paint in front of the child.

properties.name: margin
properties.docs: Empty space to surround the decoration.

properties.name: padding
properties.docs: Empty space to inscribe inside the decoration.

properties.name: transform
properties.docs: The transformation matrix to apply before painting the container.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, requires the decoration to have this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, requires the decoration to have this height.

CustomMultiChildLayout.name: CustomMultiChildLayout
CustomMultiChildLayout.docs: Defers the layout of multiple children to a delegate.

properties.name: delegate
properties.docs: The delegate that controls the layout of the children.

CustomOneChildLayout.name: CustomOneChildLayout
CustomOneChildLayout.docs: Defers the layout of its single child to a delegate.

properties.name: painter
properties.docs: The painter that paints before the children.

properties.name: foregroundPainter
properties.docs: The painter that paints after the children.

DecoratedBox.name: DecoratedBox
DecoratedBox.docs: Paints a [Decoration] either before or after its child paints.

properties.name: decoration
properties.docs: What decoration to paint.

properties.name: position
properties.docs: Where to paint the box decoration.

Dismissable.name: Dismissable
Dismissable.docs: Can be dismissed by dragging in one or more directions.

properties.name: onResized
properties.docs: Called when the widget changes size (i.e., when contracting after being dismissed).

properties.name: onDismissed
properties.docs: Called when the widget has been dismissed.

properties.name: direction
properties.docs: The direction in which the widget can be dismissed.

DragTarget.name: DragTarget
DragTarget.docs: Receives data when a [Draggable] widget is dropped.

properties.name: builder
properties.docs: Called to build the contents of this widget.

properties.name: onWillAccept
properties.docs: Called to determine whether this widget is interested in receiving a given piece of data being dragged over this drag target.

properties.name: onAccept
properties.docs: Called when an acceptable piece of data was dropped over this drag target.

Draggable.name: Draggable
Draggable.docs: Makes its child draggable starting from tap down.

DraggableBase.name: DraggableBase
DraggableBase.docs: Subclass this component to customize the gesture used to start a drag.

properties.name: feedback
properties.docs: The widget to show when a drag is under way.

properties.name: feedbackOffset
properties.docs: The feedbackOffset can be used to set the hit test target point for the purposes of finding a drag target. It is especially useful if the feedback is transformed compared to the child.

properties.name: dragAnchor
properties.docs: Where this widget should be anchored during a drag.

Flex.name: Flex
Flex.docs: Uses the flex layout algorithm for its children.

FractionallySizedBox.name: FractionallySizedBox
FractionallySizedBox.docs: Sizes itself to a fraction of the total available space.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, the factor of the incoming width to use.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, the factor of the incoming height to use.

properties.name: onTapDown
properties.docs: A pointer that might cause a tap has contacted the screen at a particular location.

properties.name: onTapUp
properties.docs: A pointer that will trigger a tap has stopped contacting the screen at a particular location.

properties.name: onTap
properties.docs: A tap has occurred.

properties.name: onTapCancel
properties.docs: The pointer that previously triggered the [onTapDown] will not end up causing a tap.

properties.name: onDoubleTap
properties.docs: The user has tapped the screen at the same location twice in quick succession.

properties.name: onLongPress
properties.docs: A pointer has remained in contact with the screen at the same location for a long period of time.

properties.name: onVerticalDragStart
properties.docs: A pointer has contacted the screen and might begin to move vertically.

properties.name: onVerticalDragUpdate
properties.docs: A pointer that is in contact with the screen and moving vertically has moved in the vertical direction.

properties.name: onVerticalDragEnd
properties.docs: A pointer that was previously in contact with the screen and moving vertically is no longer in contact with the screen and was moving at a specific velocity when it stopped contacting the screen.

properties.name: onHorizontalDragStart
properties.docs: A pointer has contacted the screen and might begin to move horizontally.

properties.name: onHorizontalDragUpdate
properties.docs: A pointer that is in contact with the screen and moving horizontally has moved in the horizontal direction.

properties.name: onHorizontalDragEnd
properties.docs: A pointer that was previously in contact with the screen and moving horizontally is no longer in contact with the screen and was moving at a specific velocity when it stopped contacting the screen.

properties.name: behavior
properties.docs: How this gesture detector should behave during hit testing.

Grid.name: Grid
Grid.docs: Uses the grid layout algorithm for its children.

properties.name: alwaysAnimate
properties.docs: If true, the hero will always animate, even if it has no matching hero to animate to or from. (This only applies if the hero is relevant; if there are multiple heroes with the same tag, only the one whose key matches the "most valuable keys" will be used.)

IndexedStack.name: IndexedStack
IndexedStack.docs: A [Stack] that shows a single child at once.

properties.name: index
properties.docs: The index of the child to show.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the non-positioned children in the stack.

IntrinsicHeight.name: IntrinsicHeight
IntrinsicHeight.docs: Sizes its child to the child's intrinsic height.

IntrinsicWidth.name: IntrinsicWidth
IntrinsicWidth.docs: Sizes its child to the child's intrinsic width.

properties.name: stepWidth
properties.docs: If non-null, force the child's width to be a multiple of this value.

properties.name: stepHeight
properties.docs: If non-null, force the child's height to be a multiple of this value.

LeafRenderObjectWidget.name: LeafRenderObjectWidget
LeafRenderObjectWidget.docs: A superclass for RenderObjectWidgets that configure RenderObject subclasses that have no children.

LongPressDraggable.name: LongPressDraggable
LongPressDraggable.docs: Makes its child draggable starting from long press.

Mimic.name: Mimic
Mimic.docs: A widget that copies the appearance of another widget.

properties.name: original
properties.docs: A handle to the widget that this widget should copy.

Mimicable.name: Mimicable
Mimicable.docs: A widget that can be copied by a [Mimic].

ModalBarrier.name: ModalBarrier
ModalBarrier.docs: Prevents the user from interacting with widgets behind itself.

properties.name: color
properties.docs: If non-null, fill the barrier with this color.

properties.name: dismissable
properties.docs: Whether touching the barrier will pop the current route off the [Navigator].

MultiChildRenderObjectWidget.name: MultiChildRenderObjectWidget
MultiChildRenderObjectWidget.docs: A superclass for RenderObjectWidgets that configure RenderObject subclasses that have a single list of children. (This superclass only provides the storage for that child list, it doesn't actually provide the updating logic.)

NetworkImage.name: NetworkImage
NetworkImage.docs: Displays an image loaded from the network.

properties.name: src
properties.docs: The URL from which to load the image.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this height.

properties.name: colorFilter
properties.docs: If non-null, apply this color filter to the image before painint.

properties.name: fit
properties.docs: How to inscribe the image into the place allocated during layout.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the image within its bounds.

properties.name: repeat
properties.docs: How to paint any portions of the layout bounds not covered by the image.

properties.name: centerSlice
properties.docs: The center slice for a nine-patch image.

OffStage.name: OffStage
OffStage.docs: Lays the child out as if it was in the tree, but without painting anything, without making the child available for hit testing, and without taking any room in the parent.

OneChildRenderObjectWidget.name: OneChildRenderObjectWidget
OneChildRenderObjectWidget.docs: A superclass for RenderObjectWidgets that configure RenderObject subclasses that have a single child slot. (This superclass only provides the storage for that child, it doesn't actually provide the updating logic.)

properties.name: opacity
properties.docs: The fraction to scale the child's alpha value.

OverflowBox.name: OverflowBox
OverflowBox.docs: A render object that imposes different constraints on its child than it gets from its parent, possibly allowing the child to overflow the parent.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.docs: The minimum width constraint to give the child. Set this to null (the default) to use the constraint from the parent instead.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.docs: The maximum width constraint to give the child. Set this to null (the default) to use the constraint from the parent instead.

properties.name: minHeight
properties.docs: The minimum height constraint to give the child. Set this to null (the default) to use the constraint from the parent instead.

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.docs: The maximum height constraint to give the child. Set this to null (the default) to use the constraint from the parent instead.

Overlay.name: Overlay
Overlay.docs: A [Stack] of entries that can be managed independently.

properties.name: initialEntries
properties.docs: The entries to include in the overlay initially.

Padding.name: Padding
Padding.docs: Insets its child by the given padding.

properties.name: padding
properties.docs: The amount to pad the child in each dimension.

Placeholder.name: Placeholder
Placeholder.docs: A widget whose child can be mutated.

PositionedTransition.name: PositionedTransition
PositionedTransition.docs: Animated version of [Positioned]. Only works if it's the child of a [Stack].

properties.name: image
properties.docs: The image to display.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this height.

properties.name: colorFilter
properties.docs: If non-null, apply this color filter to the image before painint.

properties.name: fit
properties.docs: How to inscribe the image into the place allocated during layout.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the image within its bounds.

properties.name: repeat
properties.docs: How to paint any portions of the layout bounds not covered by the image.

properties.name: centerSlice
properties.docs: The center slice for a nine-patch image.

properties.name: image
properties.docs: The image to display.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, require the image to have this height.

properties.name: colorFilter
properties.docs: If non-null, apply this color filter to the image before painint.

properties.name: fit
properties.docs: How to inscribe the image into the place allocated during layout.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the image within its bounds.

properties.name: repeat
properties.docs: How to paint any portions of the layout bounds not covered by the image.

properties.name: centerSlice
properties.docs: The center slice for a nine-patch image.

RenderObjectToWidgetAdapter.name: RenderObjectToWidgetAdapter
RenderObjectToWidgetAdapter.docs: This class provides a bridge from a RenderObject to an Element tree. The given container is the RenderObject that the Element tree should be inserted into. It must be a RenderObject that implements the RenderObjectWithChildMixin protocol. The type argument T is the kind of RenderObject that the container expects as its child.

RenderObjectWidget.name: RenderObjectWidget
RenderObjectWidget.docs: RenderObjectWidgets provide the configuration for [RenderObjectElement]s, which wrap [RenderObject]s, which provide the actual rendering of the application.

Row.name: Row
Row.docs: Lays out child elements in a row.

Scrollable.name: Scrollable
Scrollable.docs: A base class for scrollable widgets that reacts to user input and generates a scrollOffset.

ScrollableList.name: ScrollableList
ScrollableList.docs: A wrapper around [ScrollableWidgetList] that helps you translate a list of model objects into a scrollable list of widgets. Assumes all the widgets have the same height.

ScrollableMixedWidgetList.name: ScrollableMixedWidgetList
ScrollableMixedWidgetList.docs: A general scrollable list for a large number of children that might not all have the same height. Prefer [ScrollableWidgetList] when all the children have the same height because it can use that property to be more efficient. Prefer [ScrollableViewport] with a single child.

ScrollableViewport.name: ScrollableViewport
ScrollableViewport.docs: A simple scrollable widget that has a single child. Use this component if you are not worried about offscreen widgets consuming resources.

ScrollableWidgetList.name: ScrollableWidgetList
ScrollableWidgetList.docs: An optimized scrollable widget for a large number of children that are all the same size (extent) in the scrollDirection. For example for ScrollDirection.vertical itemExtent is the height of each item. Use this widget when you have a large number of children or when you are concerned

SizeObserver.name: SizeObserver
SizeObserver.docs: Calls [onSizeChanged] whenever the child's layout size changes

properties.name: onSizeChanged
properties.docs: The callback to call whenever the child's layout size changes

SizedBox.name: SizedBox
SizedBox.docs: A box with a specified size.

properties.name: width
properties.docs: If non-null, requires the child to have exactly this width.

properties.name: height
properties.docs: If non-null, requires the child to have exactly this height.

Stack.name: Stack
Stack.docs: Uses the stack layout algorithm for its children.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: How to align the non-positioned children in the stack.

StatefulComponent.name: StatefulComponent
StatefulComponent.docs: StatefulComponents provide the configuration for [StatefulComponentElement]s, which wrap [State]s, which hold mutable state and can dynamically and spontaneously ask to be rebuilt.

StatelessComponent.name: StatelessComponent
StatelessComponent.docs: StatelessComponents describe a way to compose other Widgets to form reusable parts, which doesn't depend on anything other than the configuration information in the object itself. (For compositions that can change dynamically, e.g. due to having an internal clock-driven state, or depending on some system state, use [StatefulComponent].)

properties.name: rasterizerThreshold
properties.docs: The rasterizer threshold is an integer specifying the number of frame intervals that the rasterizer must miss before it decides that the frame is suitable for capturing an SkPicture trace for further analysis.

StyledText.name: StyledText
StyledText.docs: A convience widget for paragraphs of text with heterogeneous style.

properties.name: elements
properties.docs: The recursive list of lists that describes the text and style to paint.

properties.name: data
properties.docs: The text to display.

properties.name: style
properties.docs: If non-null, the style to use for this text.

Title.name: Title
Title.docs: Controls the description of this app in the operating system.

properties.name: title
properties.docs: A one-line description of this app for use in the window manager.

properties.name: color
properties.docs: A color that the window manager should use to identify this app.

Transform.name: Transform
Transform.docs: Applies a transformation before painting its child.

properties.name: transform
properties.docs: The matrix to transform the child by during painting.

properties.name: origin
properties.docs: The origin of the coordinate system (relative to the upper left corder of this render object) in which to apply the matrix.

properties.name: alignment
properties.docs: The alignment of the origin, relative to the size of the box.

UniqueComponent.name: UniqueComponent
UniqueComponent.docs: A widget that has exactly one inflated instance in the tree.

Viewport.name: Viewport
Viewport.docs: A widget that's bigger on the inside.

properties.name: scrollDirection
properties.docs: The direction in which the child is permitted to be larger than the viewport

properties.name: scrollOffset
properties.docs: The offset at which to paint the child.

WidgetToRenderBoxAdapter.name: WidgetToRenderBoxAdapter
WidgetToRenderBoxAdapter.docs: An adapter for placing a specific [RenderBox] in the widget tree.

properties.name: renderBox
properties.docs: The render box to place in the widget tree.
